page.title: 12NATURE TRAIL, SOUTHWELL (1)
page.content: The{Southwell Trail}(an old{railway line) runs from Southwell to Farnsfield, passing through Kirklington, a length of about 4 miles. At Farnsfield, the warehouse is still standing in the station yard, and the position of the sidings can still be seen. The station house, booking hall and waiting room have been converted into a private house. The original buildings were completed in 1871, and the platform was dismantled in 1965. Just east of Farnsfield is the Waterworks, built in 191O. it pumped water from Elkesley (12 miles north) to Lincoln following the closure of the local water supply there after a typhoid epedemic. Near here is Camp Hill, the site of a Roman building.
